original: Josefson, Erik Mårten Hjalmar, grosshandlare, Ulricehamn, f. 8/7/81 i Börstig, Skarab. 1., av Josef Larsson o. Julia Jakobsson. G. 09’ m. Ingeborg Andersson. Barn: Birgit f. 10, Sten 14, Inga-Lisa 18, Anne-Marie 22. — Folkhögsk. 0’1, Holmqvists hand:-inst. i Gbg 06. Res. t. Tyskl., Danm. o. Norge uppr. ggr, Finl. 31, Ital. o. Schweiz 38. Deläg. i kolonialvarufir-ma Johan Carlsson Eftr. i Ulricehamn 11-19, start. Erik Josefson & Co. Tri-kåfabr. där 20, ombild. föret. t. A-B o. dess verkst. dir. sed. 38. Landstingsman sed. 42, led. av stadsfuldm. 18-42, fd. ordf. i drätselkamm., led. av kyrkofullm. sed. 38 o. kyrkoråd sed. 30, huv :man o. styr :led. i Ulricehamns Stads o. Redvägs Här. Sparbank, ordf. i styr. f. Sv. Hand :bankens avd :kont. o. i Ulricehamiis Tidn. A-B, led. av styr. f. Fören. f. Älvsb. 1. sjukh. m. m. RVO 40.
translated: Josefson, Erik Mårten Hjalmar, merchant, Ulricehamn. Born July 8, 1881 in Börstig, Skaraborg county, the first child of Josef Larsson and Julia Jakobsson. Married in 1909 to Ingeborg Andersson. They have four children: Birgit, born 1910; Sten, born 1914; Inga-Lisa, born 1918; Anne-Marie, born 1922. Attended Folk High School in 1901 and Holmqvist's commercial school in Gothenburg in 1906. Traveled to Germany, Denmark, and Norway several times, Finland in 1931, Italy and Switzerland in 1938. Partial owner of the colonial goods company Johan Carlsson Eftr. in Ulricehamn from 1911-1919. Started Erik Josefson & Co. Trikåfabr. in Ulricehamn in 1920, transformed the company to A-B and became its operational director in 1938. Member of the County Council since 1942, member of the City Council from 1918 to 1942, former chairman of the finance committee, member of the church board since 1930 and member of the parish council since 1938. Main person and board member of Ulricehamns Stads- och Redvägs Härads Sparbank, chairman of the board for the Swedish Handelsbanken's local branch and for Ulricehamns Tidning A-B, member of the board of the Association for Älvsborg's hospital and more. Awarded the Royal Order of Vasa in 1940.
